Class Dish

java.lang.Object
Dish
public class Dish extends Object
Represents a single menu item (dish) in the restaurant management system. This class encapsulates all dish-related data and business logic including the dish name, pricing information, display formatting, and database ID. The Dish class enforces business rules such as: - Dish IDs are assigned by the database (AUTOINCREMENT). - Dish names cannot be null, empty, or contain only whitespace. - Prices must be non-negative (free items are allowed with $0.00 price). This class follows encapsulation principles by keeping all fields private and providing controlled access through getter and setter methods with appropriate validation to maintain data integrity.
Since:
2024

  • Constructor Details

    • Dish

      public Dish(String name, double price)
      Constructs a new Dish instance for in-memory use only. Assigns a default ID of 0 (not yet persisted).
      Parameters:
      name - The dish name (will be trimmed; cannot be null or empty)
      price - The price in dollars (must be >= 0; zero allowed)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if name is invalid or price is negative

    • Dish

      public Dish(int id, String name, double price)
      Constructs a new Dish instance with a specific database ID. Use this when loading from or syncing with the database.
      Parameters:
      id - The database ID (AUTOINCREMENT value; must be >= 0)
      name - The dish name (will be trimmed; cannot be null or empty)
      price - The price in dollars (must be >= 0; zero allowed)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if id invalid input: '<' 0, name is invalid, or price is negative

    • setPrice

      public boolean setPrice(double price)
      Updates the dishâ€™s price with validation. Enforces the non-negative business rule.
      Parameters:
      price - the new price in dollars (must be >= 0)
      Returns:
      true if update succeeded; false if validation failed

    • getDisplayString

      public String getDisplayString()
      Generates a formatted string representation of the dish for display. Format: [ID] Name (20-char left-align) | $Price (6-char left-align, 2 decimals) Example: "[12] Grilled Salmon | $18.99"
      Returns:
      a string suitable for menu listings or console output
